head.title: Deal Making Heats Up as Does Food and Drug Scrutiny

hedline.hl1: Deal Making Heats Up as Does Food and Drug Scrutiny

abstract.p: Five Days column; Biomet, maker of artificial joints, accepted sweetened $11.4 billion offer from group of private equity firms; Avaya, one of world's biggest makers of corporate phone equipment, agreed to $8.2 billion deal with Silver Lake Partners and Texas Pacific Group; Palm said it would sell 25 percent stake in itself to Elevation Partners; Cadence Design Systems, which makes software that designs computer chips, has held talks with at least two private equity firms about going public (M)

block.p: Deal makers powered ahead, even as one pending merger faced a regulatory hurdle. Makers of diabetes drugs agreed to use the most severe warning on labels, and broadcasters won a favorable federal court ruling regarding obscenities.
